item.title: Repeating key xor and Hamming distance
item.description: I’ve been working through the cryptopals challenge set in Rust as a way to both learn about cryptography and learn Rust at the same time. One of the first significant challenges is writing code to break a repeating key xor cipher where you don’t know the length of the key. Without the tip on Hamming distance in the problem description, one (read: ‘I’) might attempt to solve the problem with a heinously inefficient algorithm to try every reasonable keysize.
